title: Snake Dancer
description:
Want to see a Sunday school teacher sandwich her spiritual career with political protest in the form of lewd dance? In South Africa? In the 1970s? Completely naked with snakes, puppets and more? Then you're in for a treat! Glenda Kemp, notorious South African cabaret legend, delivers in this 1970s romp through a young Sunday school teacher's exploration of taboos. 

Here's what you won't see: snakes penetrating a young girl's virginity slit. 

Here's what you WILL see: a beautiful young woman dancing nude with snakes, puppets (trust me, it works!) and other props in a truly Mondo/Grindhouse a GoGo fashion!

Glenda Kemp's semi-autobiographical flick tells the tale of a Sunday school teacher who decides, for whatever reason, to start dancing nude at clubs! She encounters the typical resistance of the Christian/racist driven politics of 1970s South Africa at the time as she slowly rises in fame. 

It's about time this goofy blast from somebody's past was released on PB! Now with the theme song as a separate music file! Enjoy!
